patch.description: All parameters available in the Create a Contact endpoint can be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the contact to update.

first_name.description: The first name of the contact.

middle_name.description: The middle name of the contact.

last_name.description: The last name of the contact.

dob.description: The date of birth of the contact. The expected format is m/d/Y (e.g.: 4/17/1993).

twitter_url.description: A Twitter URL for the contact.

linkedin_url.description: A LinkedIn URL for the contact.

facebook_url.description: A Facebook URL for the contact.

delete.description: Use this endpoint to delete a contact.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the contact to archive.

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a new contact.

parameters.name: force_create
parameters.description: Whether or not to skip de-duplication logic when creating the contact.   The de-duplication process will determine whether the contact data being submitted is a duplicate of one of your existing contacts. If a duplicate is detected, the incoming data will be merged into the existing matched contact.  Passing `true` will skip de-duplication and forcibly create the contact (given the data is valid).   By default, de-duplication logic will be applied.

first_name.description: The first name of the contact.

middle_name.description: The middle name of the contact.

last_name.description: The last name of the contact.

emails.description: The email addresses that are associated with the contact (e.g.: `"emails": [{"value": "mr@givebutter.com", "type": "personal"}]`).

phones.description: The phones numbers that are associated with the contact (e.g.: `"phones": [{"value": "609-555-1234", "type": "cell"}]`).

addresses.description: The addresses that are associated with the contact (e.g.: `"addresses": [{"address_1": "123 Sesame St", "address_2": "Suite 2B", "city": "New York City", "state": "NY", "zipcode": "10150", "country": "USA"}]`).

address_1.description: The first line of the street address (e.g.: `123 Sesame St`).

address_2.description: The second line of the street address (e.g.: `Suite #2A`).

city.description: The city of the address (e.g.: `New York City`).

country.description: The address's country in three-letter ISO code format (e.g.: `USA`).

tags.description: The tags on the contact (e.g.: `"tags": ["VIP Donor", "Monthly Donor"]`).

dob.description: Date of birth for the contact. The expected format is `m/d/Y` (e.g.: `4/17/1993`).

twitter_url.description: A Twitter URL for the contact.

linkedin_url.description: A LinkedIn URL for the contact.

facebook_url.description: A Facebook URL for the contact.

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve a list of contacts.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of contacts to retrieve: `active` (default) - Includes contacts that have not been archived. `all` - Includes all contacts regardless of archived status. `archived` - Only includes contacts that have been archived.

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve a list of your campaigns.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of campaigns to retrieve:  `null` to retrieve only your account's campaigns. `benefiting` to retrieve campaigns of which you are the beneficiary. `chapters` to retrieve campaigns owned by chapters under your account. `all` to retrieve all campaigns related to your account.

type.description: Type type of campaign to be created. Supported options are: `collect`, `fundraise`, `event`.

patch.description: All parameters available in the Create a Campaign endpoint can be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to update.

description.description: An HTML formatted description for the campaign.

end_at.description: A UTC formatted datetime string for the end date and time of the campaign. Ex: `2019-01-01 20:30:00`

slug.description: The URL slug to be used for this campaign. If none is provided, we will generate one automatically.

type.description: Type type of campaign to be created. Supported options are: `collect`, `fundraise`, `event`.

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve a list of the teams under a specific campaign.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to show.

get.description: Use this endpoint and include an id to retrieve a specific team.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to show.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The ID of the team to show.

Result.value:
{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "My team",
  "logo": "",
  "slug": "",
  "url": "",
  "raised": 1000,
  "goal": 10000,
  "supporters": 500,
  "members": 10
}

get.description: Retrieve a list of your tickets.

description.example: Ticket applicable for the General Admission section of the Reunion Party.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of transactions to retrieve:  `null` to retrieve only your account's transactions.  `benefiting` to retrieve transactions of which you are the beneficiary.  `chapters` to retrieve transactions made to chapters under your account.  `all` to retrieve all transactions related to your account.
